summary: This is an email chain between U.S. Attorney's Office personnel regarding the scheduling of Ghislaine Maxwell's trial. It includes planning for a government letter on the trial date and mentions the filing of supplemental pretrial motions by the defense.

events.title: Filing of Supplemental Pretrial Motions
events.description: The defendant's supplemental pretrial motions regarding the superseder were filed.

events.title: Government Opposition Due
events.description: The government's opposition to the defendant's supplemental pretrial motions is due.

keyFacts: The document is an internal email chain from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York regarding the Ghislaine Maxwell case.
It references the filing of supplemental pretrial motions by the defense regarding the superseder indictment.
The government's opposition to these motions is due on May 21, 2021.
The correspondence involves planning for a government letter regarding the trial date, indicating ongoing trial preparation.
All personal names in the email headers and body are redacted, appearing only as placeholders or titles (e.g., 'Assistant United States Attorney').
